DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Online Chronic Disease Self-Management Project Group Health
DOC.detailed_description: We pilot evidence-based online program chronic disease self-management model widely-replicated in-person Chronic Disease Self-management Program ( CDSMP ) develop Stanford University . The online CDSMP internet-based intervention people one chronic condition . It build self-efficacy theory structure around formal curriculum emphasize problem solving , decision making , confidence building weekly session six week . The curriculum address generic topic skill relevant manage chronic condition . The program structure around three component : 1 ) password-protected , interactive web-based instruction ; 2 ) web-based bulletin board discussion group enable participatory learn interaction ; 3 ) reference book , Living Healthy Life Chronic Conditions , contain program content supplemental information . It facilitate two trained lay moderator , least one chronic condition . Piloting online CDSMP allow Group Health learn maximize program 's impact Group Health system launch full-scale program . Since web-based intervention increasingly recognize hold promise health care , learning recommendation likely applicable beyond innovation . The pilot provide GH opportunity explore follow online CDSMP web-based tool , general : 1 . Impact online CDSMP participant ' psychosocial health status , health behavior , health service utilization 2 . Efficient process incorporate online CDSMP exist operation use PDCA cycle 3 . An understanding demographic characteristic member likely participate online self-management program in-person program 4 . Effective recruitment retention strategy 5 . Feasibility sustain program without external funding 6 . Recommendations successful implementation future innovation utilize web-based medium , social networking technology , etc .
